'''Downtown Dubai''', previously known as '''Downtown Burj Dubai''', is a large-scale mixed-use complex under development in [[Dubai]], [[United Arab Emirates]]. It is the home of some of the city's most important landmarks including [[Burj Khalifa]], [[Dubai Mall]], and [[Dubai Fountain]]. It covers an area of {{convert|2|sqkm}}, and estimated to cost US$20 [[1000000000 (number)|billion]] (Dh73 billion) upon completion.<ref>http://www.dubaitraveldesk.com/what.html</ref>
The complex is situated along [[Sheikh Zayed Road]] across from [[Al Wasl, Dubai|Al Wasl]] locality on the north-west. It is bounded to the south by [[Business Bay]] and to the north-east by Financial Centre Road, which separates it from [[Zabeel|Zabeel 2]] and [[Trade Centre 2]]. It is connected to the [[Dubai Metro]] via the Burj Khalifa/Dubai Mall Metro Station. The First Interchange, which is in the last phases of construction, will guarantee the free flow of traffic to and from the area.
Development is divided into 11 projects: Burj Khalifa, Dubai Fountain, Dubai Mall, Burj Park Island, and The Address Downtown Dubai hotel are at the center of the complex. The Old Town and The Old Town Island is mostly low-rise residential buildings, in addition to three hotels and Souq Al Bahar. Emaar Boulevard, The Residences and South Ridge comprise high-rise residential towers. And Emaar Square is a low-rise office complex.
==Landmarks== ===Burj Khalifa=== {{main|Burj Khalifa}} Burj Khalifa is a [[supertall]] [[skyscraper]], the centrepiece of Downtown Dubai. At {{convert|828|m|ft|0|abbr=on}}, it is the [[List of tallest buildings in the world|tallest building in the world]] and the [[List of tallest buildings and structures in the world|tallest man-made structure]] ever built. Construction began on 21 September 2004, and was completed and ready for occupancy by 4 January 2010. Burj Khalifa is estimated to have cost [[United States dollar|US$]]1.5 billion.<ref name="What to see">{{cite web|url=http://www.dubaitraveldesk.com/what.html|title=What to see|publisher=''Dubai Travel Desk''|accessdate=23 March 2009}}</ref>
===The Dubai Mall=== {{main|The Dubai Mall}} [[File:12062008 dubail mall galery.JPG|thumb|right|150px|Dubai Mall's interior]] The '''Dubai Mall''' is the world's largest shopping mall by total area. It is the home of 1,200 shops in addition to numerous attractions, including an olympic-sized ice rink, an aquarium and a water zoo.<ref> http://www.emaar.com/index.aspx?page=the-dubai-mall</ref><ref>[http://www.gulfnews.com/business/General/10256699.html gulfnews.com, Dubai Mall: A milestone harks back to humble origins]</ref> Access to the mall is provided via [[Doha Street]], rebuilt as a double-decker road in April 2009.<ref>{{cite news|last=Ahmed|first=Ashfaq|title=Double-decker roads will be open by month's end|work=Gulf News|page=2|date=2009-04-19|url=http://archive.gulfnews.com/nation/Traffic_and_Transport/10305345.html|accessdate=2009-04-28}}</ref> Twice delayed, Dubai Mall opened on November 4, 2008, with about 600 retailers, marking the world's largest-ever mall opening in [[retail]] history. However it is not the largest in [[List of the world's largest shopping malls|gross leasable space]], and is surpassed in that category by several malls including the [[West Edmonton Mall]], [[South China Mall]] and others.
===Dubai Fountain=== {{main|Dubai Fountain}} [[File:Burj Khalifa fountain.JPG|thumb|right|180px|Dubai Fountain]] Outside, and at a cost of Dh 800 million (US$217 million), a record-setting fountain system is to be designed by [[WET (WET Design)|WET Design]], the [[California]]-based company responsible for the fountains at the [[Bellagio Hotel]] Lake in [[Las Vegas, Nevada|Las Vegas]]. Illuminated by 6,600 lights and 50 colored projectors, it will be {{convert|275|m|ft|abbr=on}} long and will shoot water {{convert|150|m|ft|abbr=on}} into the air, accompanied by a range of classical to contemporary Arabic and world music.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.emaar.com/index.aspx?page=press-release-details&id=149|title=Emaar brings world-class water, light and music spectacle to Burj Dubai Lake|publisher=''[[Emaar Properties]]''|date=9 June 2008|accessdate=13 June 2008}}</ref> On 26 October 2008 Emaar announced that based on results of a naming contest the fountain would be called the Dubai Fountain.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.emaar.com/index.aspx?page=press-release-details&id=725|title=âDubai Fountainâ is winning name of Emaarâs water spectacle in Downtown Burj Dubai|publisher=''[[Emaar Properties]]''|date=26 October 2008|accessdate=26 October 2008}}</ref>
===The Address Downtown Dubai=== {{main|The Address Downtown Dubai}} The Address Downtown Dubai is a [[supertall]] [[skyscraper]] rising 306 meters (1,004 feet) alongside the [[Dubai Mall]], the Old Town, and the Burj Khalifa Lake in [[Dubai]], [[United Arab Emirates]].<ref name="Emp1">{{Cite web|title=The Address Downtown Burj Dubai|url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/bu/?id=220605|accessdate=2007-09-26|publisher=Emporis.com}}</ref> This hotel and residential tower contains a total of 63 [[Storey|floors]].<ref name="Emp1"/> The tower is another supertall structure in the massive development named Downtown Dubai, which includes the centerpiece supertall building, Burj Khalifa.<ref name="Emp1"/> The tower was topped out in April 2008, becoming the [[List of tallest buildings in Dubai|6th-tallest building in Dubai]] and the [[List of tallest buildings in the world|36th-tallest in the world]]. In September 2008 the tower was completed.
